metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5785 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: In OpenJPEG 2.3.0, there is an integer overflow caused by an out-of-bounds left shift in the opj_j2k_setup_encoder function (openjp2/j2k.c). Remote attackers could leverage this vulnerability to cause a denial of service via a crafted bmp file.

notes.Note: ccdm94> this vulnerability was introduced by the changes of commit 33a0e66eb12.

criterions.comment: openjpeg: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
